topics.title: Definition of a Graph
content: A graph is a collection of vertices (nodes) and edges (lines) where edges connect pairs of vertices.
Notation: G = (V, E).
Example: V = {A,B,C}, E = {(A,B),(B,C)}

topics.title: Vertices (Nodes)
content: Points in a graph that represent objects or positions.
Example: In a social network, each person is a vertex.

topics.title: Edges (Lines)
content: Connections (links) between two vertices.
Example: In a social network, a friendship between two people is an edge.

topics.title: Finite and Infinite Graphs
content: Finite Graph: Limited number of vertices and edges.
Infinite Graph: Unlimited number of vertices or edges.

topics.title: Incidence and Degree
content: Incidence: An edge is incident on a vertex if it connects to that vertex.
Degree of a Vertex: Number of edges connected to a vertex.

topics.title: In-degree and Out-degree
content: In-degree: Number of incoming edges to a vertex.
Out-degree: Number of outgoing edges from a vertex.

topics.title: Null Graph
content: A graph with only vertices and no edges.
Example: V={A,B,C}, E={}

topics.title: Subgraph
content: A part of a graph formed by taking a subset of vertices and edges.
Example: From G=(V,E) with V={A,B,C}, E={(A,B),(B,C)}, subgraph can be V’={A,B}, E’={(A,B)}

topics.title: Walk
content: A sequence of vertices and edges where each edge connects the current vertex to the next.
Vertices/edges may repeat.

topics.title: Path
content: A walk in which no vertex or edge is repeated.

topics.title: Circuit (or Cycle)
content: A path that starts and ends at the same vertex with no edge repeated.
Circuit = closed path.

topics.title: Connected and Disconnected Graphs
content: Connected Graph: Path exists between every pair of vertices.
Disconnected Graph: Some vertices are not connected.

topics.title: Components
content: The separate connected parts of a disconnected graph.

topics.title: Euler Graph
content: A graph with a closed trail (Euler circuit) visiting every edge exactly once.
Condition: All vertices must have even degree.

topics.title: Hamiltonian Path and Circuit
content: Hamiltonian Path: Visits every vertex exactly once, not necessarily returning.
Hamiltonian Circuit: Hamiltonian path that starts and ends at the same vertex.
